DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the prevalence and predictors of pituitary dysfunction, as well as secondary out-come in patients with traumatic brain injury or spontaneous subarachnoidal haemorrhages.
DOC.brief_title: Hypopituitarism Following Traumatic Brain Injury or Spontaneous Subarachnoidal Haemorrhages
DOC.criteria: Clinical diagnosis of traumatic brain injury (TBI) or subarachnoidal haemorrhages (SAH) Alcohol or drug abuse Prior TBI or SAH Chronic use of glucocorticoids Pregnancy or breast feeding Diagnosis of psychiatric diseases or malignant neoplasms
